bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Ship's engineer for the Pacific Mail Steamship Company, originally from Brunswick Co., Va. In 1873, Hackley sailed between Yokohama and Shanghai; in 1876 he was transferred to a ship running between San Francisco and Yokohama.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters written by Hackley while he worked for the Pacific Mail Steamship Company, describing his journeys and activities from San Francisco to Yokohama, Japan, Shanghai, China, and other ports in Central America; and commenting on missionary efforts in Japan, and on family matters. He also participated in mine speculation in Central America and confessed he lost his savings in the 1870s.
